form.title: Title
form.howWouldYouRateIt: How would you rate its importance
form.high: Essential — GBIF have no data in this area
form.medium: Important — GBIF have little data in this area
form.low: It would be a nice supplement to the existing data
form.followDiscussionBelow: Follow or join the further discussion on the link below.
form.saveFailure: This isn't good. We couldn't save your suggestion. Please try again later or alternatively go straight to [Github](https://github.com/gbif/data-mobilization/issues) where the suggestions are managed

observationTrends.intro: A pilot to explore whether relative observation trends for species within GBIF provide useful information for researchers
observationTrends.noData: We have no georeferenced data about the selected species after year 1900
observationTrends.resultIntro: Change in relative observation frequency for the selected area
observationTrends.embedIntro: All data mediated through the {GBIF network}

speciesLookup.description: Normalize species names from a CSV file against the GBIF backbone. The file is expected to be have a column called ‘scientificName’ and an optional column ‘kingdom’ and ‘id’.
speciesLookup.title: Species name matching

ipt.description: The Integrated Publishing Toolkit (IPT) is a free open source software tool written in Java that is used to publish and share biodiversity datasets through the GBIF network. The IPT can also be configured with either a DataCite or EZID account in order to assign DOIs to datasets transforming it into a data repository.
ipt.dontSeeYourIpt: Don't see your IPT? Send [GBIF](mailto:helpdesk@gbif.org "Mail to GBIF Helpdesk requesting IPT be added to map") your coordinates.

derivedDataset.title: Derived dataset
derivedDataset.pleaseFill: Please fill the form to submit
derivedDataset.loginToCreate: Log in to create a derived dataset
derivedDataset.mintingDoi: Minting DOI - this shouldn't take long.
derivedDataset.attachCsvLabel: Attach csv with dataset keys and occurrence counts
derivedDataset.orEnterLabel: Or enter datasets and occurrence counts here
derivedDataset.invalidFileFormat: Invalid file format - the file must be a csv file
derivedDataset.emptyFile: There are no rows in the data.
derivedDataset.tooManyRows: Too many rows (maximum 6.000) - try using [our APIs](https://techdocs.gbif.org/en/openapi/v1/registry#/Derived%20datasets) instead
